text.quote: 16: Clause 4, page 3, line 4, at end insert—
“( ) Regulations under subsection (1) shall require the periodic review of average civil compensation amounts in mesothelioma cases, such review to be conducted by an independent body.
( ) Regulations under subsection (1) shall require an annual report to both Houses of Parliament and a review of payments made under the scheme.”
17: Clause 4, page 3, line 10, at end insert—
text.IndentOne: “( ) must ensure that applicants to the scheme are reimbursed in full by the scheme for reasonable legal costs incurred by them in their pursuit of payment from an employer or an employer’s liability insurer and from their application to the scheme, over and above any other payment from the scheme.”

text.quote: 18: Clause 4, page 3, line 10, at end insert—
text.IndentOne: “( ) must ensure that payments are not less than the average award made by civil courts to mesothelioma sufferers in comparable circumstances.”

text.quote: 19: Clause 4, page 3, line 11, leave out subsection (3)
20: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) The Secretary of State may not seek repayment of that portion of any compensation or scheme payment made in respect of pain and suffering.”
21: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) All payments by the scheme shall be regarded as being made on account of pain and suffering.”
22: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) The first £75,000 of any payment by the scheme shall be regarded as being made on account of pain and suffering.”
23: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) The Secretary of State may not seek repayment of means-tested benefits until two years after the date of an award by a court or by the scheme.”
24: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) The Secretary of State may not recover non-means-tested benefits from the claimant or from any relative or carer of the claimant.”
25: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) The Secretary of State may not recover payments or benefits made more than two years before the date of an award by the scheme.”
26: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—

“( ) The Secretary of State may exercise discretion as to whether he seeks repayment of any compensation or scheme payment made to a person diagnosed with mesothelioma or from that person’s carer or close relative.”
27: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) The Secretary of State may not seek recovery of any lump sum payments previously made to mesothelioma sufferers under other publicly funded schemes.”
27A*: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—
“( ) The first £50,000 or 50% of any payment by the scheme, whichever is the larger amount, shall be regarded as being made on account of pain and suffering.”
27B*: Clause 4, page 3, line 17, at end insert—

“( ) All funds paid to claimants or their dependents by the scheme shall be deemed to have been held in trust by the scheme on behalf of the beneficiaries and shall therefore be ignored for purposes of recovery of benefits.”
28: Clause 6, page 3, line 40, at end insert—
“( ) The scheme must ensure that any reasonable costs of advice incurred by an individual in appealing to the First-tier Tribunal are reimbursed in full.”
29: Clause 7, page 4, line 11, after “may” insert “, subject to the consent of the Secretary of State,”
30: Clause 7, page 4, line 22, at end insert—

“( ) A body administering the scheme in accordance with arrangements under subsection (1)(b) must be constituted of members who are demonstrably independent of any active insurers or any person or organisation associated with an active insurer.”
31: Clause 7, page 4, line 25, at end insert—

“( ) The Secretary of State will make regulations permitting the administrators of the scheme to charge and administer an annual membership fee to be collected from each insurer, each of which contributes £10,000 to the scheme; the funds raised through this charge shall be remitted to a competent research institution to fund research to find new treatments for mesothelioma.”
32: After Clause 7, insert the following new Clause—
“Oversight Committee
(1) The Secretary of State must establish, by statutory instrument, an Oversight Committee to monitor, review and report to the Secretary of State on the overall arrangements comprising—
text.IndentOne: (d) the Employers’ Liability Tracing Office; and
text.quote: (2) The Oversight Committee must include representatives of—
text.IndentOne: and must be chaired by an independent person.”

text.quote: 43: After Clause 14, insert the following new Clause—
“Report on record keeping by insurers
text.IndentOne: The Secretary of State shall establish a commission to examine and report within one year of enactment on the history of record keeping by insurers who have provided cover against employers’ liability for mesothelioma and other long-latency asbestos-related diseases.”

text.quote: 44: Clause 15, page 8, line 21, after “may” insert “, in accordance with regulations,”
45: After Clause 16, insert the following new Clause—
“Establishing additional schemes
text.IndentOne: The Secretary of State may by regulation establish other schemes in relation to other long-latency asbestos-related diseases.”

text.quote: 46: After Clause 16, insert the following new Clause—
“Report on the establishment of other schemes
text.IndentOne: The Secretary of State will, within a year of this Act coming into force, prepare and lay before both Houses of Parliament a report setting out the Government’s plans with regards to the establishment of other schemes in relation to other asbestos or dust-related industrial diseases covered by the Pneumoconiosis etc. (Workers’ Compensation) Act 1979.”

text.quote: 47*: After Clause 16, insert the following new Clause—
“Establishing additional schemes (No. 2)
text.IndentOne: The Secretary of State shall by regulation establish another scheme in relation to long-latency asbestos-related diseases in current and retired members of the Armed Forces.”
